intro: Disynaphia achillea, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white. The plant is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy inflorescences. Disynaphia achillea is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
